results.title: Dial M for murder (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Alfred Hitchcock agreed to direct this masterful adaption of the broadway play by Frederick Knott merely to fulfil studio contractual obligations but “Dial M for murder” became one of his most acclaimed thrillers. Anxious to inherit his wife’s fortune, society playboy Tony Wendice (Ray Milland) ingeniously plots her murder. Blackmailing a former associate with a criminal record, he arranges what appears to be a perfect crime. However, his scheme is foiled when Margot (Grace Kelly) stabs her attacker with scissors. Wendice must now take his sinister web of intrigue in a different direction to cover his tracks. Co-starring John Williams.

results.title: Red river(Captioned)
results.brief_description: Director Howard Hawks’ classic western stars the legendary John Wayne at the peak of his career and Montgomery Clift in his screen debut. Walter Brennan heads the outstanding supporting cast. The film is an account of the first cattle drive over the Chisolm Trail, from deep Texas to Abilene, Kansas. Authentic detail and stunning cinematography bring to life the trials and tribulations of this extraordinary challenge for the men who battled the dust, rain, heat and frustration of the long, hard drive. The demands of this rigorous journey further strain the edgy relationship between the film’s key characters. Tom Dunson (John Wayne) is a self-made cattle king whose single-mindedness has turned him into a cold-blooded executioner, ruthlessly determined to take the cattle to Abilene his way. Arguably the best western ever produced, “Red River” captures both the grandeur of the early West and the sheer determination of its people.

results.title: Calamity Jane (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: David Butler, William Jacobs and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The Wild West in a spectacular musical with Doris Day as Calamity Jane and Howard Keel as Wild Bill Hickcock. Calamity Jane arrives from the “Windy city” after finding a star attraction for the local saloon. As she is taken by the “Deadwood Stage” to the “Black hills of Dakota”, she meets Wild Bill Hickock, her “Secret love”.

results.title: JFK: Director's cut; Beyond JFK: the question of the conspiracy (S) (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Oliver Stone, A. Kitman Ho and Ixtlan Corporation
results.brief_description: Starring Kevin Costner, Joe Pesci, Tommy Lee Jones and Gary Oldman, JFK also features an extensive gallery of appearances by acclaimed actors including Ed Asner, Walter Matthau, Jack Lemmon and Donald Sutherland. This release has an additional 17 minutes of footage, providing more excitement, intrigue and insight into Jim Garrison’s turbulent investigation of President John F. Kennedy’s assassination. “Beyond JFK: the question of conspiracy” is a ninety minute documentary re-examining the issues raised by the film and features interviews with persons involved in the Garrison investigation plus astonishing eyewitness accounts. Includes Jim Garrison’s last recorded interview prior to his death.

results.title: Chitty Chitty Bang Bang (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ken Hughes, Albert R. Broccoli, Dramatic Features, Warfield Productions and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: The author of James Bond, Ian Fleming, wrote this charming story of a car that could fly. This is a wonderful musical/comedy fantasy for the whole family starring Dick Van Dyke and Gert Frobe. It is recreated for the screen by the director Ken Hughes of “Those Magnificent Men in Their Flying Machines”.

results.title: Dog day afternoon (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Sidney Lumet, Martin Bregman, Martin Elfand and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: On August 22, 1972, a ninety-seven degree day in New York City, an extraordinary robbery occured minutes before closing in a branch of the Chase Manhattan Bank. As the blistering day progressed, details about two incompetent robbers and their victims emerged. In a Borough, where the absurd is commonplace, these details developed into one of the most bizarre news stories of the year. Starring Al Pacino, John Cazale, James Broderick, Charles Durning and Chris Sarandon.

results.title: The Secret garden (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Fred M Wilcox, Clarence Brown and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A delightful dramatisation based on the well-known children’s book of the same name. A young girl comes to live in a run down Victorian estate and finds an abandoned garden which she cares for. She befriends the young crippled son of the house - with amazing results. Starring Margaret O’Brien and Dean Stcokwell.

results.title: The Greatest show on Earth
results.creator_credit: Cecil B. DeMille and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Cecil B. DeMille blended drama with spectacle, using the Ringling Bros. Barnum & Bailey Circus as a backdrop. The film is a behind-the- scenes look at the triumphs and conflicts of circus performers. The magic and thrill of life under the Big Top is stunningly recreated. The all-star cast includes Betty Hutton, Cornel Wilde, Charlton Heston, Dorothy Lamour and James Stewart as “Buttons the Clown”. Filled with romance, intrigue and high-flying acrobatics, “The Greatest Show on Earth” is exactly that.

results.title: Ordinary people
results.creator_credit: Robert Redford, Ronald L Schwary, Paramount Pictures and Wildwood Enterprises
results.brief_description: Ordinary people places the “modern middle-class American family” under a microscope. Mary Tyler Moore and Donald Sutherland are the ideal couple, until their lives are shattered by the tragic death of their oldest son in a boating accident. Their perfect world is turned upside down as their youngest son, (Timothy Hutton) attempts suicide in order to ease the burden of guilt. An empathetic psychiatrist (Judd Hirsch), provides the teenager with a lifeline on the road to recovery. Mary Tyler Moore’s performance as the cold and aloof mother is outstanding. Donald Sutherland as the weak, ineffectual but loving father, grapples to come to terms with the tensions in his family relationships to which he was oblivious. Compelling and moving, “Ordinary people” is an outstanding directorial debut by Robert Redford. Based on novel by Judith Guest.

results.title: On the Beach
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kramer, Lomitas Productions and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: On the Beach is one of the most celebrated anti-nuclear films in motion picture history. Based on the novel by Nevil Shute, it is the story of US Naval commander Dwight Towers, who is sent to assist Australian authorities after the rest of the world has been devastated by a nuclear holocaust.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Stanley Kramer, Lomitas Productions and United Artists Corporation
results.description: ‘On the Beach’ is one of the most celebrated anti-nuclear films in motion picture history. Based on the novel by Nevil Shute, it is the story of US Naval commander Dwight Towers, who is sent to assist Australian authorities after the rest of the world has been devastated by a nuclear holocaust. Towers must attempt to save a small group of survivors as impending doom approaches.
